intro: Triteleia howellii, commonly known as Howell's triteleia, is a flowering plant native to California. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale purple. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and coastal scrub. It produces a basal rosette of narrow, grass-like leaves and has a short, stout stem. Triteleia howellii is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to the Mediterranean climate of its native range.
